title: [Damn it]Oil in English Mode
author: Оil
txt_content:
Emmm...as you see here I am forced in English mode,that means,I have to text in English,due to my laptop typewriting faliure.
Suspecting that the major reason might be a mistake on language setting,I just mistakenly setting English as Windows display language,even so,it cannot fully explains why my Chinese tpyewriting is restricted,though I attempted to unlocked it by re-install it.
D.a.m.n?So guys don't be surprised once I hit you with [ruby=Yeah that's what I think as least]a long and sticky paragraph[/ruby] texted in English!-------That just a terrible program failure!
Please forgive me if there's any grammatical mistake in my comment or text,thx!

Picture for the end:

(C*ka blyat!)

END.

replies.author: Mitotsudaira
replies.txt_content:
Try the following tips for your language input problem:
1. Restart your PC (although I suspect you've done this already)
2. Reinstall your language pack
If you are using Win7, this language pack can be found at Microsoft's official page. If Win10, go to "language and region" and its a click right away.
3. Check your keyboard, either USB or build-in
I once met a similar situation during which my keyboard was broken and cannot switch between input language, so if you have any usb-keyboard, try to unplug it.

4. Install your OS again (brutal ultimate way to solve any problem at once)

Anyway good luck wwwwwwwwww
